intro: Cynorkis melinantha, commonly known as the yellow bell orchid, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its roots are fibrous, and it produces small, greenish leaves. Cynorkis melinantha is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements.
